title: Swimming & Diving
description: Dive into your knowledge of competitive swimming, diving, and aquatic sports!

questions.question: How many Olympic medals did Michael Phelps win in total across his career?
questions.explanation: Michael Phelps won 28 Olympic medals (23 gold, 3 silver, 2 bronze), making him the most decorated Olympian of all time. He competed in five Olympic Games from 2000 to 2016.

questions.question: What are the four competitive swimming strokes?
questions.explanation: The four competitive swimming strokes are freestyle (front crawl), backstroke, breaststroke, and butterfly. The individual medley (IM) combines all four strokes in one race.

questions.question: What is the standard length of an Olympic swimming pool?
questions.explanation: An Olympic swimming pool is 50 meters long, often called a 'long course' pool. Short course pools are 25 meters. The pool must have 8 lanes for Olympic competition.

questions.question: In competitive diving, what is a 'pike' position?
options: Body bent at the hips with straight legs
questions.explanation: In the pike position, the diver bends at the hips with legs straight and toes pointed, forming an L or V shape. The three main diving positions are tuck, pike, and straight (layout).

questions.question: How high is the Olympic platform diving board?
questions.explanation: The Olympic platform diving board is 10 meters (approximately 33 feet) high. The springboard events are held at 3 meters. Divers hit the water at speeds of up to 35 mph from the platform.

questions.question: What is the individual medley (IM) in swimming?
options: A race combining all four strokes
A race using only one stroke
questions.explanation: The individual medley combines all four strokes in one race: butterfly, backstroke, breaststroke, then freestyle. The most common distances are 200m and 400m IM.

questions.question: Which Australian swimmer is known as 'The Thorpedo'?
questions.explanation: Ian Thorpe, nicknamed 'The Thorpedo' and 'Thorpey,' won five Olympic gold medals. He was known for his remarkably large feet (size 17) and powerful freestyle stroke.

questions.question: What is synchronized swimming now officially called?
questions.explanation: In 2017, FINA (now World Aquatics) officially renamed synchronized swimming to 'artistic swimming.' The sport combines swimming, dance, and gymnastics performed in water.

questions.question: What is water polo?
options: A team sport played in water with goals and a ball
questions.explanation: Water polo is a team sport played in a pool where two teams of seven try to throw a ball into the opposing team's goal. It has been an Olympic sport since 1900.

questions.question: Which female swimmer won the most Olympic gold medals?
questions.explanation: Jenny Thompson won 8 Olympic gold medals (all in relay events) across four Olympic Games (1992-2004). Katie Ledecky has won 7 individual Olympic gold medals.

questions.question: What technique is used at the start of a backstroke race?
options: Starting in the water holding the wall
questions.explanation: In backstroke races, swimmers start in the water while gripping a handle on the starting block or the pool wall, then push off backward at the starting signal.

questions.question: What is open water swimming in the Olympics?
options: A pool race with no lane ropes
A relay in an outdoor pool
A long-distance race in a natural body of water
questions.explanation: Open water swimming is a long-distance race (10 km at the Olympics) conducted in a natural body of water such as a lake, river, or ocean. It became an Olympic event in 2008.

questions.question: Which country has historically dominated Olympic diving?
questions.explanation: China has dominated Olympic diving since the 1980s, winning the majority of gold medals. Chinese divers have won over 40 Olympic gold medals in the sport.

questions.question: How many lanes does a standard Olympic swimming pool have?
questions.explanation: A standard Olympic swimming pool has 8 lanes, each 2.5 meters wide. The pool is 50 meters long and at least 2 meters deep.

questions.question: What is the 'dolphin kick' used in?
questions.explanation: The dolphin kick is the primary kicking technique used in the butterfly stroke. Both legs move together in a wave-like motion resembling a dolphin's tail. It is also used in underwater phases of all strokes.
